title: How to back up your data and keep it safe
description: Experts recommend using three drives to back up your data and using cloud-based services.

description: One in ten Buy Now Pay Later shoppers have been chased by debt collectors, Citizen's Advice says.

title: Paddle boarder's close encounter with two curious whales

description: In many EU circles, the honeymoon period for Donald Trump's successor may be coming to an end.

description: Professor Kim Hyung-suk had breakfast with the man who would rule North Korea for nearly 50 years

title: Coronavirus: 'Baking boom saw them fighting over my flour'
description: Nigel Moon, 69, has dedicated much of his life to restoring and running Whissendine Windmill.

title: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and the Child Victims Act
description: Thousands of child sex abuse claims have been filed thanks to a change in New York law.

title: Canada federal election: How much trouble is Trudeau in?
description: Canada's leader called a snap election, but midway through the campaign his party is struggling.

description: West Ham's Ben Johnson takes MOTDx back to his roots as the defender talks through his journey from an academy prospect to scoring his first Premier League goal.

description: The UK has promised to resettle 20,000 Afghan refugees. Where will they live?

title: England v India: Chris Woakes has Rohit Sharma caught behind for 11

description: Some leaders in England and Wales discourage reporting abuse to protect reputations, an inquiry finds.

description: The online shopping giant says it will give a bonus to workers at some sites for good attendance.

description: Tom Cruise's movies are put on hold as studios fear a recent US Covid spike will deter cinemagoers.

description: Sarah Storey wins her 17th Paralympic gold to become Great Britain's most successful Paralympian of all time.

description: Gym Group says it has seen a "rapid recovery" in membership numbers and plans to open 40 more sites.

description: Gareth Southgate says England should "get its own house in order" before criticising others for their behaviour.
